title: Cultural Interaction Guidelines
brief: Follow essential behavioral rules when interacting with local populations to maintain safety and gain help.
steps: Step 1: Accept what people offer and share equally with all present.
Step 2: Eat in the same way they eat and try to eat everything offered.
Step 3: Make payment of some kind for food, supplies, or help received.
Step 4: Keep any promises you make to local people.
Step 5: Respect personal property and do not enter houses unless invited.
Step 6: Build separate shelter if possible to avoid contagious diseases.
Step 7: Prepare your own food and drink when possible without giving offense.
Step 8: Avoid physical contact and sexual contact - many consider touching taboo.
warnings: Be very cautious when touching people - it may be dangerous in some cultures.
Local people may seriously reduce their own supplies to feed strangers.
Use 'personal or religious custom' to explain isolationist behavior if needed.
Do not bully, laugh at, or show disrespect to local people.
